reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cashtronauts is incredibly fun. The goal is to collect money which unlocks risks which increase the amount of money you earn. The risks fundamentally change the game. For example, one adds civilian ships which drop upgrades for your ship. Others add different types of minerals to the game that sell for varying amounts based on in-game legality and rarity. I've played for a few hours and the game continues to be fun because the risks are constantly changing the gameplay.

When you hit the later game the risks do start to slow down and it can take many games before you unlock another risk. Thankfully the developer has tweaked the game so that risks will continue to come in more frequently. Though I haven't unlocked them all yet, I do hope to see many more risks added to the game. I haven't unlocked the final two risks, but having some more ship variety would be amazing. Of course the game is in Early Access currently, so there's still plenty of time for improvements.

Overall I would absolutely recommend playing Cashtronauts. It's super fun. If you want to see more gameplay of Cashtronauts, I have a series of videos for it here! https://youtu.be/XCliuFb6pdk?list=PLw7LcwDs7sjyG34x-7cpgOmGdUlUwvQlr

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer - I have been gifted a free key for this game for review purposes, however my review will be kept as truthful as possible, since I am meant to help developers and buyers/gamers.

Cashtronauts Review:

Overview
Cashtronauts is a game where you get rich and unlock risks, which then give boosts to your income depending on how hard they are. You can collect money by selling ores and Teeth dropped by Raptors, which are enemy ships who are on the hunt for you once you go outside your city barrier. You have limited fuel and ammunition, which can be refilled/restocked, so is your health, however it's not replenishable, so fight wisely! You can carry only so much items at a time, whether it to be teeth or ore, so you have to make many trips from outer space back to your settlement to be as efficient as possible ,you're going to need lucky and hopefully you won't bump into any cops or Raptors trying to kill you. Speaking of cops and murder, don't carry red ores! You will be murdered, it is illegal to carry around. This is a sandbox game, where the only objective is to get as much money as you can in a run, which unlocks more risks once certain money milestones are achieved to get even more money. Some risks give invisibility cloaks to unseen Raptors, other introduce new gameplay mechanics, such as civilian transport ships (murderable, carry lots of money, will get you into police trouble) and generally the more riks the more fun the game is.

Gameplay
It's a sandbox playing area which at early game is a bit difficult to navigate due to not having any minimap of any sort, but easy to pick up the general game. The speed rapidly builds up as you unlock the harder risks, such as sometimes while on low fuel you accidentally shoot a passerby insetad of an enemy. This builds up adrenalin and tense times that will be remembered. This technique leads to many addictions being made along with an actual relationship to the ship you're playing as. It's simple to understand. You get items to sell, you sell them, get rich, restock, repeat. Over, and over, and over. It's fun, knowing your ship can blow up at any time when your about to beat an all time high score.

Pros and Cons
Pros:
Fun
Simple
Addictive
Cheap
More game coming
Clean graphical look

Cons:
Not that much game once you get later into it

Finale
The game is good right now, will only get better as time goes along. Gets an 8/10 from me.
I have been gifted the key by the kind developers of the game. They make my review about games like this possible.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cashtronauts is a twin-stick shooter where your only goal is to become as rich as possible. No matter how many innocents (or pirates) need to die along the way you must become the wealthiest spaceship pilot in the galaxy.

We've all played twin-sticker shooters before so we know that aspect of gameplay. It works well here, one stick to move and one to shoot it's pretty simple. What makes this game special then? It's the mechanics built around the shooter.

You are playing in space where you have to monitor your ammo, fuel, and cargo space. The ammo and fuel is purchasable from two floating space stations. You cargo can be ejected from your ship if you need to or you can sell it to the mining space station. You earn money by collecting floating cash in space, destroying asteroids to pick up contraband to sell to the miner, or kill all the pirates you want (or kill the police and stupid innocent people).

Cashtronauts introduces a Risk mechanic, where as you play and collect money you will unlock one of several different risks. Each risk increases the percentage of money you earn, whether that be collecting it from crates, shooting pirates or cops, or turning in mined drugs (red pill or blue pill, I'm not sure if they are drugs but they look like space drugs to me. In addition to increasing the money earned percentage, each risk also changes the game in someway. The first I unlocked made the Raptor enemies gain cloak, it also made them drop Raptor Teeth when they died, which I could turn in at the police station for a nice bounty. The second added Reddium, which was an illegal red mined ore (or drug) that I could sell to the miner, however, being illegal it would make me wanted by the police until I sold the cargo or dumped it. You can choose which, if any, of the risks you want to use in between each run.

Overall I think Cashtronauts takes the twin-stick shooter in a challenging and fun direction and the risk mechanic adds for a nice depth too the gameplay. I'm looking forward to new risks and enemies as the game makes it's way through early access.

https://youtu.be/vG7U2MQCCac

For more reviews and the biweekly podcast - EarlyAccessMedia.com and YouTube.com/EarlyAccessPodcast

Fun little indie game with simple rules: you're piloting a twin-stick spaceship (playing with a controller) in which you must collect as much money as possible until you die.

They are several ways to collect cash: blowing up other spaceships (enemy and/or ally), collecting materials, destroying crates, and so on.

The most interesting feature is the risk system: you unlock risk" while progressing in the game. Those risks give you new ways to earn more money when enable
date: but it also comes with a hazard (ex: raptor ships will drop priceless materials when destroyed
recommended: but they'll now have a cloaking device).\n\nThe game has a single and a multiplayer mode (local only). I’m enjoying the game so far in the single player mode
hoursPlayed:
but I can tell that it has a lot of potential to be an amazing party game!

Hope it'll have a multiplayer mode via network!!
Also love the retro 8-bit soundtrack!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I fully get what the developer is aimng to do here and I like some what this game does, but right now it's just not enough that I can recommend it.

Yes, it's still in Early Access (as I type) but not much has changed in the last few months so I'm posting my 10p now and we'll see what changes later.

Right now, my problem is that it's a one-trick-pony game - the 'Risks' system is great but it's the ONLY reason to play the game.  You will play and play simple to unlock more risks to continue playing to unlock more...

Nothing else matters or changes, really.  You need to repeatedly head-out/earn/return/sell/restock/repeat until you die but outside of Risk unlocks, there's NOTHING else going-on here?

I don't think that's enough to make a game - I think there needs to be more for the player to discover/unlock/upgrade - some reason to do it.

So right now it's a No" - it needs something else to make every game worth playing rather than just a grind for cash which unlocks risks (which increases cash

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really enjoyed Cashtronauts, It really is such an addictive, fun little game!

The game features a risk system which changes gameplay up in various ways while also increasing the profit earned on each run you do. On these runs you must collect as much money as you can, you also have the choice to destroy civilian ships while having to avoid Space Police (which are extremely deadly) and huge space pirate ambushes!

There are 10 risks at the moment that change the gameplay up big time, these risks can sometimes make the game a bit more challenging by increasing enemies health / damage but also increasing the amount of gold dropped, or will spawn in random items around space that you can find and destroy for a big amount of mixed loot. This game also has big updates planned which is excellent to see.

I recommend this game to everyone that enjoys space shooters!

Great job Jeux Simon Prefontaine Games Inc!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cashtronauts is a mine asteroids indie space game, where you hunt pirates or civilian ships to get your hands into cash. If you are sneaky, you can get pass the cops with illegal loot.

The games main focus is money. You are flying in a little ship with ammo and fuel to collect and smell the cash you collect. There is plenty of loot to sell, and moste of it is illegal. The cops will or might notice your arrival with illegal loot and hunt you down, or if you kill civilians. The pirates can hide and are carrying a small amount of cash, but they are a deadly threat for your business. As soon as you beat the games challenges and getting your fingers in a high amount of cash, new loots will unlock etc. Gold. Each unlock or loot will change your money making plans to reach agens success.

While flying around either with keyboard or controller, you will fast notice that fuel and ammo for protection is going to be a need. The important part is that the city is a safe area, which means no pirates or deadly threats than cops is around your neck.

If you like money, selling it and doing illegal business to see your money counter raise, then this game is for you.

Here is a pre-demo:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is great, even in early access.  If you like upgrade games and/or space shooters and/or resource gathering games, this will be a winner.

The dev seems active and willing to garner ideas from the playerbase so I expect it will only improve.

Early Access Review

First time I got a coupon for 90% off a game that is actually worth more than 10% of its regular price.

Basically an extended space arcade game, with a larger arena and a less frenetic pace than a typical one. Basically it's about mining, looting, shooting and avoiding being shot. Your basic income is to collect minerals by shooting rocks to pieces, but as the game expands more riskful options become available and the game often puts you in situations where you'll want to chose between safely hauling your cargo back to base or risking it all for a much bigger reward. Overall the concept is basic, but it's well executed. The controls are fluid, though right stick aiming feels a bit inexact – but that could be my controller getting old. Cash accumulation over multiple plays to unlock the Risks that unlock gameplay features with new challenges and bonuses lends the game a rougelike-like-like-like generation/legacy element.

Also posive, for an early access release, is that the developer seems dedicated and has an active and friendly presence on the forums. The game is already technically solid and in a very enjoyable state, more or less a finished product, and with a few more planned features mentioned I think it's looking very good.

With a demo or other way to try the concept hands-on I would gladly have paid full price.

Early Access Review

There is a fun base here, still a lot to be done.

Early Access Review

Good solid, basic entertainment.

I fear it won't last the test of time, but for a short while, I find it an excelent diversion.

The good: simple basic gameplay.  Easy to figure out what is your goals are, and what you need to do to accomplish them.

And, most important, it is fun!

The bad: upgrading your ship is clunky.  You can only upgrade once, and the others you should sell, but you are not told that.... opps.  You can upgrade your ammo and fuel, but not the shield" of your ship.  Only way to get health back is via leveling up.  Leveling up doesn't scale as you level up - so if you are getting a 200% bonus to your loot
date: leveling up from L1 to L3 basically is 2 seconds - which feels like a waste of those heals as they get hard to come by.\n\nWould really recommend potion health drops
recommended: and a shield / armor mod and a more damage / shoot more bullets mod.\n\nI expect I will get about 12-15 hours total in before I get tired of the game - but for the price I paid that is an excelent deal - and I hope the dev finds it worth wild as well."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had been waiting for this to come out on Xbox One, but I got impatient and simple bought the PC version. I can't believe I waited so long. This game is very addictive and quite fun. It has LOADS of potential.

I think there are some areas that can be expanded upon, some UI tweaks, and controller corrections, but NONE of this detracts from the game itself. It's a solid, fun, lovable game.

I cannot wait to see whatelse this developer has in store for us.

Early Access Review\n\nAn early access game done right, a fun and addictive space roguelike with a decent amount of things to unlock. Looking forward to seeing this game evolve into a great game. With a few more ships and more risks to work towards, this will be even more enjoyable and add more play time. Would recommend buying!!

Early Access Review

Fun! Simple concept. It's a rogue-like space shooter where you're trying to make as much money as possible before you die. You only heal by leveling up... and leveling up takes expontentially more money each time :D.

The more you unlock, the more options you have. In the beginning you mine... and hope for some lucky cash crate drops. Later on I'm massacreing civvy ships, fighting off crazy pirate missile boats, selling equipment and gold and... well lets just say I really enjoyed the progression.
Early Access Review\n\nIm writing this review in a hurry but yeah, the game is definitely worth a shot.

Early Access Review\n\nGreat game! Interesting concept too. Really fun when playing with a small group :). I look all the time for good local games where you can play with buddies, and this has made the list.
